text: Wilbur "Shorty" Luft (June 1, 1908 – December 20, 1991) was an American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at Central Washington University from 1948 to 1949, compiling a record of 8–9–1. Luft was a quarterback at Washington State University in the early 1930s and was named the starter for the 1931 Rose Bowl. ==Head coaching record== ===College=== ==References== Category:1908 births Category:1991 deaths Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Central Washington Wildcats football coaches Category:Washington State Cougars football players Category:High school football coaches in Washington (state)
title: Wilbur Luft
